original_title: When There Is No More Music to Write, and Other Roman Stories
overview: Rome, years of lead. Aldo Moro is kidnapped in the fervor of the Red Brigades. The armed struggle is propelled towards a political dead end. Alvin Curran, mythical figure of the musical Avant-Garde, strives to dissolve the figure of the author in the collective. The notion of instruments is extended to natural and everyday objects, producing revolutionary works.
title: When There Is No More Music to Write, and Other Roman Stories
